intro: Caesia chlorantha, commonly known as the green-flowered caesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Caesia chlorantha typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. It is often found in the coastal plain regions of Georgia, Florida, and South Carolina.
